page.title: 07A chronology
page.content: When Sir Thomas de Kerdeston died in 1446,it was decided that he died not possessed of Claxton and other manors,and that William de la Pole,was the heir so that Elizabeth,the daughter and heiress of Sir Thomas lost her inheritance.Edmund de la Pole in the 12th century granted her several Norfolk manors.Claxton passed to Thomas Howard,Earl of Surrey.Then according to Blomefield,on the death of the Duchess of Norfolk,this Lordship was granted to Charles Brandon.It is referred to several times in the Paston Letters and there is a tradition that Anne of Cleves,the dispised wife of Henry VIII,not only owned Claxton Castle but lived there for a time.
